description.compact: Request represents an HTTP request.

docblock.description: The methods dealing with URL accept / return a raw path (% encoded): * getBasePath * getBaseUrl * getPathInfo * getRequestUri * getUri * getUriForPath

description.compact: Names for headers that can be trusted when using trusted proxies.

docblock.description:
The FORWARDED header is the standard as of rfc7239.
The other headers are non-standard, but widely used by popular reverse proxies (like Apache mod_proxy or Amazon EC2).

description.compact: Custom parameters.
Request body parameters ($_POST).
Query string parameters ($_GET).
Server and execution environment parameters ($_SERVER).
Uploaded files ($_FILES).
Cookies ($_COOKIE).
Headers (taken from the $_SERVER).

param.description: The request attributes (parameters parsed from the PATH_INFO, ...)

description.compact: Sets the parameters for this request.

docblock.description: This method also re-initializes all properties.

param.description: The request attributes (parameters parsed from the PATH_INFO, ...)

description.compact: Creates a new request with values from PHP's super globals.

comment.value: With the php's bug #66606, the php's built-in web server
stores the Content-Type and Content-Length header values in
HTTP_CONTENT_TYPE and HTTP_CONTENT_LENGTH fields.

description.compact: Creates a Request based on a given URI and configuration.

docblock.description: The information contained in the URI always take precedence over the other information (server and parameters).

description.compact: Sets a callable able to create a Request instance.

docblock.description: This is mainly useful when you need to override the Request class to keep BC with an existing system. It should not be used for any other purpose.

description.compact: Clones a request and overrides some of its parameters.

param.description: The request attributes (parameters parsed from the PATH_INFO, ...)

description.compact: Clones the current request.

docblock.description: Note that the session is not cloned as duplicated requests are most of the time sub-requests of the main one.

description.compact: Returns the request as a string.
Overrides the PHP global variables according to this request instance.

docblock.description: It overrides $_GET, $_POST, $_REQUEST, $_SERVER, $_COOKIE. $_FILES is never overridden, see rfc1867

description.compact: Sets a list of trusted proxies.

docblock.description: You should only list the reverse proxies that you manage directly.

description.compact: Gets the list of trusted proxies.
Sets a list of trusted host patterns.

docblock.description: You should only list the hosts you manage using regexs.

param.description: A list of trusted host patterns

comment.value: we need to reset trusted hosts on trusted host patterns change

description.compact: Gets the list of trusted host patterns.

return.description: An array of trusted host patterns.

description.compact: Sets the name for trusted headers.

docblock.description:
The following header keys are supported:
* Request::HEADER_CLIENT_IP: defaults to X-Forwarded-For (see getClientIp()) * Request::HEADER_CLIENT_HOST: defaults to X-Forwarded-Host (see getHost()) * Request::HEADER_CLIENT_PORT: defaults to X-Forwarded-Port (see getPort()) * Request::HEADER_CLIENT_PROTO: defaults to X-Forwarded-Proto (see getScheme() and isSecure())
Setting an empty value allows to disable the trusted header for the given key.

description.compact: Gets the trusted proxy header name.
Normalizes a query string.

docblock.description: It builds a normalized query string, where keys/value pairs are alphabetized, have consistent escaping and unneeded delimiters are removed.

return.description: A normalized query string for the Request

description.compact: Enables support for the _method request parameter to determine the intended HTTP method.

docblock.description:
Be warned that enabling this feature might lead to CSRF issues in your code. Check that you are using CSRF tokens when required. If the HTTP method parameter override is enabled, an html-form with method "POST" can be altered and used to send a "PUT" or "DELETE" request via the _method request parameter. If these methods are not protected against CSRF, this presents a possible vulnerability.
The HTTP method can only be overridden when the real HTTP method is POST.

description.compact: Checks whether support for the _method request parameter is enabled.

return.description: True when the _method request parameter is enabled, false otherwise

description.compact: Gets a "parameter" value.

docblock.description:
This method is mainly useful for libraries that want to provide some flexibility.
Order of precedence: GET, PATH, POST
Avoid using this method in controllers:
* slow * prefer to get from a "named" source
It is better to explicitly get request parameters from the appropriate public property instead (query, attributes, request).

param.description: is parameter deep in multidimensional array

description.compact: Gets the Session.
Whether the request contains a Session which was started in one of the previous requests.

comment.value: the check for $this->session avoids malicious users trying to fake a session cookie with proper name

description.compact: Whether the request contains a Session object.

docblock.description: This method does not give any information about the state of the session object, like whether the session is started or not. It is just a way to check if this Request is associated with a Session instance.

return.description: true when the Request contains a Session object, false otherwise

description.compact: Sets the Session.
Returns the client IP addresses.

docblock.description:
In the returned array the most trusted IP address is first, and the least trusted one last. The "real" client IP address is the last one, but this is also the least trusted one. Trusted proxies are stripped.
Use this method carefully; you should use getClientIp() instead.

comment.value: Complete the IP chain with the IP the request actually came from
Fallback to this when the client IP falls into the range of trusted proxies
Now the IP chain contains only untrusted proxies and the client IP

description.compact: Returns the client IP address.

docblock.description:
This method can read the client IP address from the "X-Forwarded-For" header when trusted proxies were set via "setTrustedProxies()". The "X-Forwarded-For" header value is a comma+space separated list of IP addresses, the left-most being the original client, and each successive proxy that passed the request adding the IP address where it received the request from.
If your reverse proxy uses a different header name than "X-Forwarded-For", ("Client-Ip" for instance), configure it via "setTrustedHeaderName()" with the "client-ip" key.

description.compact: Returns current script name.
Returns the path being requested relative to the executed script.

docblock.description:
The path info always starts with a /.
Suppose this request is instantiated from /mysite on localhost:
* http://localhost/mysite returns an empty string * http://localhost/mysite/about returns '/about' * http://localhost/mysite/enco%20ded returns '/enco%20ded' * http://localhost/mysite/about?var=1 returns '/about'

description.compact: Returns the root path from which this request is executed.

docblock.description:
Suppose that an index.php file instantiates this request object:
* http://localhost/index.php returns an empty string * http://localhost/index.php/page returns an empty string * http://localhost/web/index.php returns '/web' * http://localhost/we%20b/index.php returns '/we%20b'

description.compact: Returns the root URL from which this request is executed.

docblock.description:
The base URL never ends with a /.
This is similar to getBasePath(), except that it also includes the script filename (e.g. index.php) if one exists.

description.compact: Gets the request's scheme.
Returns the port on which the request is made.

docblock.description:
This method can read the client port from the "X-Forwarded-Port" header when trusted proxies were set via "setTrustedProxies()".
The "X-Forwarded-Port" header must contain the client port.
If your reverse proxy uses a different header name than "X-Forwarded-Port", configure it via "setTrustedHeaderName()" with the "client-port" key.

description.compact: Returns the user.
Returns the password.
Gets the user info.

return.description: A user name and, optionally, scheme-specific information about how to gain authorization to access the server

description.compact: Returns the HTTP host being requested.

docblock.description: The port name will be appended to the host if it's non-standard.

description.compact: Returns the requested URI (path and query string).

return.description: The raw URI (i.e. not URI decoded)

description.compact: Gets the scheme and HTTP host.

docblock.description: If the URL was called with basic authentication, the user and the password are not added to the generated string.

description.compact: Generates a normalized URI (URL) for the Request.

return.description: A normalized URI (URL) for the Request

description.compact: Generates a normalized URI for the given path.

param.description: A path to use instead of the current one

return.description: The normalized URI for the path

description.compact: Returns the path as relative reference from the current Request path.

docblock.description:
Only the URIs path component (no schema, host etc.) is relevant and must be given. Both paths must be absolute and not contain relative parts. Relative URLs from one resource to another are useful when generating self-contained downloadable document archives. Furthermore, they can be used to reduce the link size in documents.
Example target paths, given a base path of "/a/b/c/d": - "/a/b/c/d" -> "" - "/a/b/c/" -> "./" - "/a/b/" -> "../" - "/a/b/c/other" -> "other" - "/a/x/y" -> "../../x/y"

comment.value: be sure that we are dealing with an absolute path
A reference to the same base directory or an empty subdirectory must be prefixed with "./".
This also applies to a segment with a colon character (e.g., "file:colon") that cannot be used
as the first segment of a relative-path reference, as it would be mistaken for a scheme name
(see http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-4.2).

description.compact: Generates the normalized query string for the Request.

docblock.description: It builds a normalized query string, where keys/value pairs are alphabetized and have consistent escaping.

return.description: A normalized query string for the Request

description.compact: Checks whether the request is secure or not.

docblock.description:
This method can read the client protocol from the "X-Forwarded-Proto" header when trusted proxies were set via "setTrustedProxies()".
The "X-Forwarded-Proto" header must contain the protocol: "https" or "http".
If your reverse proxy uses a different header name than "X-Forwarded-Proto" ("SSL_HTTPS" for instance), configure it via "setTrustedHeaderName()" with the "client-proto" key.

description.compact: Returns the host name.

docblock.description:
This method can read the client host name from the "X-Forwarded-Host" header when trusted proxies were set via "setTrustedProxies()".
The "X-Forwarded-Host" header must contain the client host name.
If your reverse proxy uses a different header name than "X-Forwarded-Host", configure it via "setTrustedHeaderName()" with the "client-host" key.

throws.description: when the host name is invalid

comment.value: trim and remove port number from host
host is lowercase as per RFC 952/2181
as the host can come from the user (HTTP_HOST and depending on the configuration, SERVER_NAME too can come from the user)
check that it does not contain forbidden characters (see RFC 952 and RFC 2181)
use preg_replace() instead of preg_match() to prevent DoS attacks with long host names

description.compact: Sets the request method.
Gets the request "intended" method.

docblock.description:
If the X-HTTP-Method-Override header is set, and if the method is a POST, then it is used to determine the "real" intended HTTP method.
The _method request parameter can also be used to determine the HTTP method, but only if enableHttpMethodParameterOverride() has been called.
The method is always an uppercased string.

description.compact: Gets the "real" request method.
Gets the mime type associated with the format.

return.description: The associated mime type (null if not found)

description.compact: Gets the format associated with the mime type.
Associates a format with mime types.

param.description: The associated mime types (the preferred one must be the first as it will be used as the content type)

description.compact: Gets the request format.

docblock.description:
Here is the process to determine the format:
* format defined by the user (with setRequestFormat()) * _format request parameter * $default

description.compact: Sets the request format.
Gets the format associated with the request.

return.description: The format (null if no content type is present)

description.compact: Sets the default locale.
Get the default locale.
Sets the locale.
Get the locale.
Checks if the request method is of specified type.
Checks whether the method is safe or not.
Returns the request body content.

param.description: If true, a resource will be returned

return.description: The request body content or a resource to read the body stream.

description.compact: Gets the Etags.
Returns the preferred language.

param.description: An array of ordered available locales

description.compact: Gets a list of languages acceptable by the client browser.

return.description: Languages ordered in the user browser preferences

description.compact: Gets a list of charsets acceptable by the client browser.

return.description: List of charsets in preferable order

description.compact: Gets a list of encodings acceptable by the client browser.

return.description: List of encodings in preferable order

description.compact: Gets a list of content types acceptable by the client browser.

return.description: List of content types in preferable order

description.compact: Returns true if the request is a XMLHttpRequest.

docblock.description: It works if your JavaScript library sets an X-Requested-With HTTP header. It is known to work with common JavaScript frameworks:

return.description: true if the request is an XMLHttpRequest, false otherwise

comment.value: normalize the request URI to ease creating sub-requests from this request

description.compact: Prepares the base URL.

comment.value: Does the baseUrl have anything in common with the request_uri?
If using mod_rewrite or ISAPI_Rewrite strip the script filename
out of baseUrl. $pos !== 0 makes sure it is not matching a value
from PATH_INFO or QUERY_STRING

description.compact: Prepares the base path.
Prepares the path info.

comment.value: Remove the query string from REQUEST_URI

description.compact: Initializes HTTP request formats.
Sets the default PHP locale.

comment.value: if either the class Locale doesn't exist, or an exception is thrown when
setting the default locale, the intl module is not installed, and
the call can be ignored:
